title: diana needs to be toned down again.
body: she is at that point of her champion lifespan where she deals too much damage while being too tanky. its time to take the nerf bat to her again.

replies.body: someone got destroyed by a fed Diana it seems

I learned Mordekaiser just so I could make life hell for Diana mains.

And then they gutted his mid.

Most balanced champ in the game. She can snowball and therefore she's op right?

I mean come on people. I get why people complain about Leblanc or fizz or even Annie. But Diana?!?! Come on man... Diana is the most balanced champion in my opinion. Before I started playing Diana I used to always smack her around with swain... Diana's biggest weaknesses are swain Annie and vlads pretty annoying too. She is tragic pre-6. If you die to Diana pre-6 just stop playing this game...
As for team fighting she is super duper balanced. Has to hit a skill shot to even ult in, and basically has to hit the right target cause otherwise she's going to be in your stack and dead in seconds. This champ needs no nerfs or buffs she is perfect

She doesn't really have to hit a skillshot.  For one, she can ult on an enemy anytime she wants.  Its just better if you don't for obvious reasons.
Besides, her 'skillshot' (easiest thing in League to lane lol) is on a 4 second cooldown at max rank so its not like missing it is a big deal.  But even if you do miss it, alot of your damage comes from her passive which does the most damage out of every spell that she has.  
I just don't think she is all that balanced.

I'm not sure if she needs nerfs. She always manages to feel super overbearing to play against because her burst is super high, and her never-ending shield makes killing her feel impossible. She's like an AP Riven but with more burst and less mobility.

I have sorta thought his for a while now.  Sure... she can't do much if she doesn't hit her Q or whatever, but eventually she will hit it... and when she does she will probably kill you without you having much counterplay against it.  Personally, I hate Diana.
She has way more counterplay than Yasuo does. She has no escapes. He has a wind wall and extreme mobility not to mention an annoying ass shield. She is perfectly balanced right now.

She has a shit ton of burst potential, she can be tanky-ish as well.  Her shield is massive.  
Yasuo has a tornado that he has to hit to lane his ult, which doesn't do a lot of damage really.
In teamfights he has the potential to die before he can even trigger his tornado, therefore he is team reliant alot of times.   The window for punishing Yasuo's windwall is like 10 seconds, which is longer than Dianas.  Yasuo does have mobility, however Diana doesn't need mobility because of her tankyness and burst potential.  
You could have the argument that you could just dodge her Q, but eventually she will hit one, and then she will probably kill ya.  And she snowballs easy.
She isn't balanced at all man.

Because she is a fighter, not an assassin. That's why she is more tanky than the assassins. Good Lord. Yasuo's can always find a way to hit their tornado, and their double crit damage is insane. The shield always comes back up within a few seconds and by then he has healed from what little damage you were able to do to him if any at all because he probably would've spit his wall out of his ass, and then he jump on you. 

I disagree. I'm a level 5 Diana and usually beat the crap out of Zed. But last night I hit a Q, ulted in, before I could do any damage he turned around on me and killed me because I didn't stupidly see how much MR he had in his runes and masteries. Not all the time can she do that. Plus if she does manage to hit a Q, just get some MR and have your tanks go after her. That's her main weakness, tanks and being CC'd to death. 

Her numbers are in a fine spot. She has no mobility outside her ult. Her slow length isn't that big and her shield only blocks so much. She is balanced compared to other champs on here and isn't broken.

Yasuo's main role is fighter, assassin is his secondary role.
Diana is listed as Fighter, but can kill as quickly as an assassin while having the same health and frontline ability as an fighter.
Yasuo can't really frontline because he is squish.  Compared to Yasuo (and alot of other things) Diana is indeed overpowered.

She is not overpowered. Her kit is fine and is not overloaded like Yasuo's or Ekko's is. Just like Annie, people QQ because they get roasted and don't know how to play against them. She doesn't need touching because some whiny people can't get over how to kill them.

It's really getting ridiculous and on my nerves because Diana is my favorite champ and people are whining about her. She's fine.

It's because hey have the ability
To do an obscene amount of damage and 100-0 you. So unless your smart in lane you will let them snowball.
This is why when so many of you cry op it's just laughable. Learn to deal with assassins. And if your just not that good, then don't pick your lane first. I can first pick Diana Jaycee lb brand swain Etc and not worry about being counter picked. But if I pick let's say Yasuo who I suck with then I' have the possibility of letting the enemy snowball. If you aren't comfortable with your lane/champ then don't complain when the enemy picks a snowballing champ and trashes you.

Thinking about it, LB matchup is actually pretty bearable. I usually win against Yasuo but I didn't think that was a full blown counter kind of deal. Yea most of the time I can beat them, but every once in awhile an actual good player gives me a fit and sometimes even beats me as they outplayed me or stacked mega resistances in their runes/masteries that I didn't check for before going in.

No it has her listed as Fighter / Mage. What makes her a fighter you ask? Let's compare her to a very popular fighter {{champion:24}}. They both have empowered autos on their 3rd attack. Jax has leap strike which jumps to an enemy and deals damage, sound familiar? His ulti increases his magic resist and armor and Diana has a shield in place of that. Jax has a aoe stun, Diana has a aoe slow / knockup. Neither one of them have escapes if they commit with their gap closer and they want to get off as many autos as possible. 

Now let's compare {{champion:131}} to an assassin that's closest to her... {{champion:245}}. Now Ekko also has an empowered 3rd auto but only if he's attacking the exact same target for all 3 attacks but it then goes on cooldown for a few seconds. Basically saying "don't stay and keep autoing". Unlike Diana and Jax he wants to nuke a SINGLE TARGET with his passive and not just try to get off multiple autos on anyone around him. He has 2 escapes helping him get in and out of fights pretty easily after he's blown up his target and even has a slow. Now Ekko does have a shield but its also associated with his stun. If he doesn't get the stun off he can't sit in a fight like {{champion:24}} and {{champion:131}} can. That's why they are Fighters, they go into a fight and FIGHT. They don't leave after they blow 1 person up. Ekko is an assassin, he goes in blows someone up and then has the means of getting out of there. He has to wait for all his cooldowns to deal damage while the FIGHTERS, don't.
